activities.loc: Courtroom D, Fourth Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin Frank Markley III

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment

11:31 AM Defendant Benjamin Frank Markley in court by phone with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video. David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily. Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond to continue.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on February 15, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Activity:
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:12 PM Defendant Benjamin Frank Markley in court by video in custody with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video.  Emmeline Lee appeared by video with legal intern Margaret Ginocchio by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant address verified.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Cash bond set of $5000 with conditions.

No possession of any electronic devices that have access to the internet. No contact with any minors. Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
